source.description: Data about a filesystem represented in XML.

test-case.name: WhereExpr001
test-case.description: For+Where+Return - test existence of child elements in Where clause
test-case.test: if ( count( for $f in //* where $f/File return $f/File[1] ) = count( //File[1]) ) then <Same/> else <notSame/>

test-case.name: WhereExpr002
test-case.description: For+Where+Return - error, variable in 'Where' Expr hasn't been defined
test-case.test: for $folder in //Folder where $folde/@name = "ABC" return <folder/>

test-case.name: WhereExpr003
test-case.description: For+Where+Return - using same predicate (as FLWOR003) in 'Where' predicate
test-case.test: for $d in /MyComputer/Drive4 where $d/Folder[@id="128"] return <FolderName>{$d/Folder/@name}</FolderName>

test-case.name: WhereExpr004
test-case.description: For+Where+Return - filters in 'Where' expr and in 'In' expr using predicate
test-case.test: for $f in /MyComputer/Drive1/Folder[@creator="Mani"]/File where $f/@creation_date="08/06/00" return $f

result.assert-xml: <File creation_date="08/06/00" creator="Leon" name="File00000000000" type="FileType" idref="1" id="2"> <FileName>File00000000000</FileName> <description> abides fullest charms aprons batter perspective brags yesterday honor bluest<bold> wills crimeful calm lobby truer miser perseus take</bold> tapers owe ceas rhyme mindful surly suspect fantasticoes spirits legitimation holofernes portraiture trouts suffocating deed strides ithaca<bold> smiles sunshine loud right disdainfully figs searching</bold> curl reins humble nurture hue doom hidden abridgement seein<bold> invisible authentic shapes quae several reaches howled</bold> merry purpos howl burneth scholars untreasur maidenliest dealing</description> <SecurityObject name="so00000000001"> <Denies> <Deny> <security/> <user>system\Changyuan</user> </Deny> <Deny> <security> <right>Read</right> </security> <user>system\Toshiko</user> </Deny> </Denies> <Allows> <Allow> <security> <right>Read</right> <right>Write</right> </security> <user>system\Hyungjeong</user> </Allow> </Allows> </SecurityObject> <Stream binary="false" streamid="1" content-type="text/xml" size="1001.33" name="sample.xml" type="StreamType"> <StreamType>StreamType</StreamType> <StreamSize>1001.33</StreamSize> <StreamID>1</StreamID> <Binary>false</Binary> <Summary>This value is constant</Summary> </Stream> </File>

test-case.name: WhereExpr005
test-case.description: For+Where+Return - use always-false-predicate in 'Where' expr
test-case.test: <empty> { for $folder in /MyComputer/Drive2//Folder where 1 = 2 return <Folder> { $folder/FolderName/text() } </Folder> } </empty>

test-case.name: WhereExpr006
test-case.description: For+Where+Return - In the inner For+Where+Return, uses outer variable in 'Where' expr
test-case.test: for $folder in /MyComputer/Drive4//Folder return <Folder>{ $folder/@name }{ for $file in /MyComputer/Drive4//File where $file/@idref = $folder/@id return <File>{ $file/@name }</File> }</Folder>

result.assert-xml: <Folder name="Folder00000000047"/><Folder name="Folder00000000048"><File name="File00000000077"/><File name="File00000000078"/><File name="File00000000079"/><File name="File00000000080"/><File name="File00000000081"/></Folder><Folder name="Folder00000000049"><File name="File00000000082"/><File name="File00000000083"/><File name="File00000000084"/><File name="File00000000085"/><File name="File00000000086"/></Folder><Folder name="Folder00000000050"><File name="File00000000087"/><File name="File00000000088"/></Folder><Folder name="Folder00000000051"><File name="File00000000089"/><File name="File00000000090"/><File name="File00000000091"/><File name="File00000000092"/><File name="File00000000093"/><File name="File00000000094"/></Folder><Folder name="Folder00000000052"><File name="File00000000095"/><File name="File00000000096"/></Folder><Folder name="Folder00000000053"><File name="File00000000097"/><File name="File00000000098"/><File name="File00000000099"/></Folder><Folder name="Folder00000000054"><File name="File00000000100"/></Folder>

test-case.name: WhereExpr007
test-case.description: For+Where+Return - 2 iterations use 'Where' to build relationship
test-case.test: <fragment-result>{ for $folder in /MyComputer/Drive3/Folder ,$file in /MyComputer/Drive3/Folder/File where $folder/@id = $file/@idref return <Folder> { $folder/@name, $folder/@id } <file>{ $file/@idref, $file/FileName/text() }</file> </Folder> }</fragment-result>

test-case.name: WhereExpr008
test-case.description: Test 'where' expression with the empty sequence literal
test-case.test: <empty> { for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where () return $file/FileName } </empty>

test-case.name: WhereExpr009
test-case.description: Test 'where' expression returning a sequence with one or more nodes
test-case.test: for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where $file/SecurityObject/Denies/Deny/security/right return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr010
test-case.description: Test 'where' expression returning a sequence with multiple values
test-case.test: for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where data( $file/SecurityObject//right ) return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr013
test-case.description: Test 'where' expression returning a sequence with a single boolean value
test-case.test: for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where $file/SecurityObject/Denies/Deny/security/right="Change" return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr014
test-case.description: Test 'where' expression returning a sequence with a constant boolean value
test-case.test: for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where true() return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr015
test-case.description: Test 'where' expression returning a sequence with a constant boolean value
test-case.test: <empty> { for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where false() return $file/FileName } </empty>

test-case.name: WhereExpr016
test-case.description: Test 'where' clause based on a positional variable
test-case.test: for $file at $offset in (//Folder)[1]/File where $offset mod 2 = 1 return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr017
test-case.description: Attempt to use multiple expressions in a 'where' clause
test-case.test: for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where true(), true() return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr018
test-case.description: Use of undefined variable in 'where' clause
test-case.test: for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where $undefined return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr019
test-case.description: Typo on 'where' clause
test-case.test: for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where_ true() return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr020
test-case.description: Multiple 'where' clauses (XQuery 1.0)
test-case.test: for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where true() where false() return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr020a
test-case.description: Multiple 'where' clauses (XQuery 3,0)
test-case.test: for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where true() where false() return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr021
test-case.description: Check that context item is NOT changed when evaluating the where clause
test-case.test: for $file in (//Folder)[1]/File where (. instance of element(File)) return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr022
test-case.description: Composite where clause depending on multiple variables
test-case.test: for $file in //File let $namelen := string-length($file/FileName) where ($namelen = 15 and $file//Allow/user = 'system\Hyungjeong') return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr023
test-case.description: Where clause appearing after a count clause
test-case.test: for $file in //File count $c where ($file//Allow/user = 'system\Aladin') return $c

test-case.name: WhereExpr024
test-case.description: Multiple where clauses in suboptimal order
test-case.test: for $file in //File let $prefix := substring($file/FileName, 1, 4) where ($prefix = 'File') where ($file//Allow/user = 'system\Hyungjeong') return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr025
test-case.description: Where clause with no dependencies on FLWOR variables
test-case.test: for $file in //File where current-date() gt xs:date('1900-01-01') let $prefix := substring($file/FileName, 1, 4) where ($prefix = 'File') where ($file//Allow/user = 'system\Hyungjeong') return $file/FileName

test-case.name: WhereExpr026
test-case.description: Where clause that depends on position()

test-case.name: WhereExpr027
test-case.description: Where clause that depends on last()

test-case.name: WhereExpr028
test-case.description: Where clause with let (and no for)
test-case.test: let $x := 1 to 10 where $x = 1 return $x

test-case.name: WhereExpr029
test-case.description: Where clause with let (and no for)
test-case.test: let $x := 1 to 10 where count($x) = 1 return $x

test-case.name: WhereExpr030
test-case.description: Where clause with "outer for"
test-case.test: declare variable $n external := 10; for $x allowing empty in 1 to $n where $x lt 5 return $x

test-case.name: WhereExpr031
test-case.description: Where clause with "outer for"

test-case.name: WhereExpr032
test-case.description: Where clause with "outer for". A trap for systems that rewrite where clauses as predicates.

test-case.name: WhereExpr033
test-case.description: Integer-valued where clause. A trap for systems that rewrite where clauses as predicates.
test-case.test: declare variable $n external := 0; for $x in -2 to +2 where ($n - $x) return $x

test-case.name: whereClause-1
test-case.description: use of where clause involving an "or" expression. Use fn:true()
test-case.test: let $var := (fn:true()) where $var or fn:true() return $var or fn:true()

test-case.name: whereClause-2
test-case.description: use of where clause involving an "or" expression. Use fn:false() Use fn:not()
test-case.test: let $var := (fn:false()) where fn:not($var or fn:false()) return $var or fn:false()

test-case.name: whereClause-3
test-case.description: use of where clause involving an "or" ("and" operator) expression. Use fn:true()
test-case.test: let $var := (fn:true()) where $var and fn:true() return $var and fn:true()

test-case.name: whereClause-4
test-case.description: use of where clause involving an "or" ("and" operator) expression. Use fn:false() Use fn:not()
test-case.test: let $var := (fn:false()) where fn:not($var and fn:false()) return $var and fn:false()

test-case.name: whereClause-5
test-case.description: use of where clause with a typeswitch expression
test-case.test: let $var := 100 where typeswitch($var) case $i as xs:string return fn:false() case $i as xs:integer return fn:true() default return fn:false() return $var

test-case.name: whereClause-6
test-case.description: use of where clause used with a string value and fn:string
test-case.test: let $var := "String" where fn:string($var) = "String" return $var

test-case.name: whereClause-7
test-case.description: use of where clause used with a string-length function.
test-case.test: let $var := "String" where fn:string-length($var) = 6 return fn:string-length($var)

test-case.name: whereClause-8
test-case.description: use of where clause used with a fn:count() function.
test-case.test: let $var := 100 where fn:count(($var)) = 1 return fn:count(($var))

test-case.name: whereClause-9
test-case.description: use of where clause used with is comparator.
test-case.test: let $var := <anElement>Some content</anElement> where $var is $var return $var is $var

test-case.name: whereClause-10
test-case.description: use of where clause used with quantified expression (some keyword).

test-case.name: whereClause-11
test-case.description: use of where clause used with quantified expression (every keyword).

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-1
test-case.description: A for/where combination where the cardinality of the return statement is crucially affected by the binding sequence.
test-case.test: (for $fo in (1, 2, 3) where $fo eq 3 return $fo)

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-2
test-case.description: Get the string value of the return statement of a for expression after being filtered by a where clause.
test-case.test: string(exactly-one((for $fo in (1, 2, 3) where $fo eq 3 return $fo)))

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-3
test-case.description: A where clause containing a value which EBV cannot be extracted from.
test-case.test: count((for $fo in (1, 2, 3) where xs:time("08:08:23Z") return $fo)) eq 3

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-4
test-case.description: A for/where expression combined with fn:count().
test-case.test: for $i in 1 where count(($i, 2, timezone-from-time(current-time()))) return true()

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-5
test-case.description: A for expression binding to one single value, combined with a positive where clause.
test-case.test: empty(for $i in 1 where false() return $i)

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-6
test-case.description: A for expression binding to one single value, combined with a negative where clause.
test-case.test: (for $i in 1 where true() return $i) eq 1

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-7
test-case.description: A for expression binding to one single value, combined with a positive where clause.
test-case.test: empty(for $i in 1 where (1, current-time())[1] treat as xs:integer eq 0 return $i)

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-8
test-case.description: A for expression binding to one single value, combined with a negative where clause.
test-case.test: (for $i in 1 where (1, current-time())[1] treat as xs:integer eq 1 return $i) eq 1

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-9
test-case.description: A for/where expression combined with fn:boolean.
test-case.test: for $i in (1, 2, current-time())[1] where fn:boolean($i treat as xs:integer) return true()

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-10
test-case.description: A for/where expression combined with fn:boolean and xs:anyURI.
test-case.test: for $i in (1, 2, current-time())[1] where xs:anyURI("example.com/") return true()

test-case.name: K-WhereExpr-11
test-case.description: A for/where expression combined with fn:boolean and xs:anyURI.
test-case.test: empty(for $i in (1, 2, current-time())[1] where xs:anyURI("") return true())

test-case.name: K2-WhereExpr-1
test-case.description: Multiple where clauses is not allowed in XQuery 1.0.
test-case.test: for $a in 1 where true() where true() return $a

test-case.name: K2-WhereExpr-1b
test-case.description: Multiple where clauses are allowed in XQuery 3.0.
test-case.test: for $a in 1 where true() where true() return $a

test-case.name: K2-WhereExpr-2
test-case.description: Multiple where clauses is not allowed(#2).
test-case.test: for $a in 1 where true(), true() return $a

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-1
test-case.description: A query that can be optimized down to a hash join - testing that the implicit cast-operand is emulated correctly
test-case.test: for $x in (xs:untypedAtomic("123"), xs:untypedAtomic("234")) for $y in (xs:string("123"), xs:float(123), xs:double(123)) where $x = $y return $x

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-2
test-case.description: A query that can be optimized down to a hash join - with integer types.
test-case.test: for $x in (xs:integer("123"), xs:integer("234")) for $y in (xs:integer("123"), xs:integer("456")) where $x = $y return $x

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-3
test-case.description: A query that can be optimized down to a hash join - with date types of varying timezones, assumes context timezone Z

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-4
test-case.description: A query that can be optimized down to a hash join - with a mixture of untypedAtomics and doubles.
test-case.test: for $x in (xs:untypedAtomic("2.0"), xs:untypedAtomic("3"), xs:double("3.0")) for $y in (xs:untypedAtomic("2"), xs:untypedAtomic("3"), xs:double("3")) where $x = $y return $x

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-005
test-case.description: Test tricky hash-join implicit conversion case.
test-case.test: declare function local:durationOrFloat($i as xs:integer) { (xs:float(123), xs:float(234), xs:duration("P1D"))[$i] }; for $x in (xs:untypedAtomic("123"), xs:untypedAtomic("234")) for $y in (for $z in (1,2) return local:durationOrFloat($z)) where $x = $y return $x

test-case.name: cbcl-product-001
test-case.description: Test products which return empty sequence
test-case.test: declare function local:odds($arg as xs:integer*) as xs:integer* { $arg[. mod 2 eq 1] }; boolean(zero-or-one(for $x in local:odds((2,4,8)),$y in local:odds((2,4,8)) return ($x,$y)))

test-case.name: cbcl-set-from-optional-item-001
test-case.description: Tests set from optional item returning empty sequence
test-case.test: declare function local:odds($arg as xs:integer?) as xs:integer? { $arg[. mod 2 eq 1] }; boolean(for $x in local:odds(2) where $x < 3 return $x + 1)

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-006
test-case.description: Test a hash join that produces a dynamic type check error
test-case.test: declare function local:sequence($arg as xs:integer) as item()* { if ($arg mod 2 eq 0) then (1, 3, 5, 7, 9) else ("a", "b", "c") }; for $x in local:sequence(2) for $y in local:sequence(3) where $x = $y return ($x, $y)

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-007
test-case.description: Test a hash join that produces a static type check error, but is fine in dynamic mode
test-case.test: declare function local:sequence($arg as xs:integer) as item()* { if ($arg mod 2 eq 0) then (1, 3, 5, 7, 9) else ("a", "b", "c") }; for $x in local:sequence(2) for $y in local:sequence(2) where $x = $y return ($x, $y)

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-008
test-case.description: Test a hash join that casts untypedAtomic values to multiple types
test-case.test: declare function local:sequence($arg as xs:integer) as item()* { if ($arg mod 2 eq 0) then (1, 3, 5, 7, 9, "cheese") else (xs:untypedAtomic("1"), xs:untypedAtomic("2")) }; for $x in local:sequence(2) for $y in local:sequence(3) where $x = $y return ($x, $y)

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-009
test-case.description: Test a hash join with type error
test-case.test: for $x in (1,2,3,"cheese") for $y in (1,2,3,"cheese") where $x = $y return ($x, $y)

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-010
test-case.description: Test hash-join requiring untypedAtomic casting, with a type error.
test-case.test: for $x in (1,2,3, xs:untypedAtomic("1")) for $y in (1,2,3,"cheese") where $x = $y return ($x, $y)

test-case.name: cbcl-group-by-key-001
test-case.description: Test producing a group-by-key expression
test-case.test: declare function local:get-words() { tokenize("she sells sea shells by the sea shore", "\s+") }; let $words := local:get-words() let $distinct-words := distinct-values($words) for $word in $distinct-words return <word word="{$word}" count="{count($words[. = $word])}" />

result.assert-xml: <word word="she" count="1"/><word word="sells" count="1"/><word word="sea" count="2"/><word word="shells" count="1"/><word word="by" count="1"/><word word="the" count="1"/><word word="shore" count="1"/>

test-case.name: cbcl-group-by-key-002
test-case.description: A variant on group-by-key that does not involve a left outer join
test-case.test: let $items := for $x in 1 to 100 return $x mod 10, $distinct-items := distinct-values($items) for $dist in $distinct-items, $item in $items where $item = $dist return $item

test-case.name: cbcl-group-by-key-003
test-case.description: A group-by-key that has to be careful about errors
test-case.test: let $items := for $x in 1 to 100 return $x mod 10, $distinct-items := distinct-values($items) for $dist in $distinct-items return min( if ($dist = 0) then 0 else for $item in $items where $item = $dist return 1 div $item )

test-case.name: cbcl-group-by-key-004
test-case.description: A group by that has to be careful about errors
test-case.test: let $items := for $x in 1 to 100 return $x mod 10, $distinct-items := distinct-values($items) for $dist in $distinct-items return min( for $item in $items where $item = $dist return if ($dist = 0) then 0 else 1 div $item )

test-case.name: cbcl-left-outer-join-001
test-case.description: A left outer join with some tricky error avoidance
test-case.test: let $items := for $x in 1 to 100 return $x mod 10, $distinct-items := for $y in 1 to (count($items) idiv 10) return $y mod 10 for $dist in $distinct-items return if ($dist = 0) then 0 else min( for $item in $items where $item = $dist return 1 div $item )

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-011
test-case.description: Test a hash join with sequences for keys

test-case.name: cbcl-map-concat-001
test-case.description: Test to hit EvaluateOptional on MapConcatSingle
test-case.test: declare function local:f($x) { if ($x) then true() else () }; declare function local:g($x) { if ($x) then "true" else "false" }; let $x := local:g(true()) for $y in local:f($x) return ($y, $x)

test-case.name: cbcl-map-concat-002
test-case.description: Test to hit Evaluate on MapConcatOptional
test-case.test: declare function local:f($x) { if ($x) then true() else () }; empty(for $x in local:f(false()), $y in 1 to 10 return ($x, $y))

test-case.name: cbcl-map-concat-003
test-case.description: Test product with optional input
test-case.test: declare function local:f($x) { if ($x) then true() else () }; for $x in local:f(true()), $y in 1 to 10 return ($x, $y)

result.assert-string-value: true 1 true 2 true 3 true 4 true 5 true 6 true 7 true 8 true 9 true 10

test-case.name: cbcl-left-outer-join-002
test-case.description: A left outer join that requires tricky predicate hoisting to spot.
test-case.test: { for $x in 1 to 10 return {for $y in 1 to 10 where $x > 7 and $y = $x return $y} }

test-case.name: cbcl-left-outer-join-003
test-case.description: A left outer join with multiple predicates
test-case.test: { for $x in 1 to 10 where $x > 7 return {for $y in 1 to 10 where $y = $x return $y} }

test-case.name: cbcl-left-outer-join-004
test-case.test:
{ let $rows := Acetazolamide Acetazolamide Acetazolamide sodium Acetazolamide sodium
Acetylcholine chloride Acetylcholine chloride
Acetylcysteine Acetylcysteine Acetylcysteine sodium Acetylcysteine sodium
/table/row return for $g in distinct-values($rows/entry[2][string(.)]) order by $g return let $matches := for $row in $rows where $g = string($row/entry[2][string(.)]) return $row/entry[1] return { $matches/( { node() } , text { if (position() lt last()) then '; ' else () } ) } }

test-case.name: cbcl-hash-join-012
test-case.description: Tests hash join between anyAtomicType containing only untypedAtomic and string
test-case.test: declare variable $strings := ('1','2'); declare variable $untypeds := (<untyped>1</untyped>,<untyped>2</untyped>); for $string in $strings for $untyped in $untypeds where $untyped = $string return $string
